intro: Pentapyxis, commonly known as the five-lobed acanthus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. The leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive lobed or serrated appearance. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, Pentapyxis species are often cultivated for their ornamental value. These plants thrive in moist, well-drained soils and require partial to full sunlight.
